required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of Caffeine on Deep Inferior Epigastric Perforator (DIEP) Flap Perfusion
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Caffeine on DIEP Flap Perfusion: A Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Women that require breast reconstruction and meet eligibility will be enrolled in this study. The study is being completed to determine the effect of caffeine in deep inferior epigastric perforator (DIEP) flap perfusion using the Vioptix tissue oximeter monitor and to determine if caffeine in the acute postoperative period affects overall flap complication or loss (complete loss from anastomotic issue).
The researchers hypothesize that a single 8 ounce cup of regular coffee will not affect free flap perfusion as indicated by the Vioptix, and that it will not affect overall free flap survival at thirty days.

study_design_info.masking_description: Patient and observer will be blinded to which group they were assigned.

primary_outcome.description: The total number of patients recruited per month, the rate of successful enrollment, and the rate of successful study completion will be evaluated.

primary_outcome.measure: Absolute value of tissue oxygenation saturation (StO2)
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 165 minutes (30 minutes prior to coffee consumption, 15 minutes for coffee consumption, 120 more minutes after consumption)
primary_outcome.description: St02 will be measured using the Vioptix tissue oximeter monitor. These will be summarized using means and standard deviations.

primary_outcome.measure: Absolute value of tissue oxygenation saturation (StO2) rate of change
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 165 minutes (30 minutes prior to coffee consumption, 15 minutes for coffee consumption, 120 more minutes after consumption)
primary_outcome.description: St02 will be measured using the Vioptix tissue oximeter monitor. These will be summarized using means and standard deviations.

primary_outcome.measure: Absolute value of tissue oxygenation saturation (StO2) amount of change
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 165 minutes (30 minutes prior to coffee consumption, 15 minutes for coffee consumption, 120 more minutes after consumption)
primary_outcome.description: St02 will be measured using the Vioptix tissue oximeter monitor. These will be summarized using means and standard deviations.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of minor flap complications in the caffeine and non-caffeine groups
secondary_outcome.description: The complications will include delayed wound healing, wound dehiscence, hematoma, seroma formation, and infections requiring antibiotics.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of major flap complications in the caffeine and non-caffeine groups
secondary_outcome.description: These complications will include any event that results in an unplanned trip to the operating room (e.g. arterial or venous thrombosis), and flap loss (e.g. flap failure, flap death).

intervention.description: A single 8 ounce cup of regular starbucks coffee will be given to the participant in the am post operative day two. Participants will have 15 minutes to consume the coffee. Additionally, medical record data will be collected up to 30 days after surgery.

A single 8 ounce cup of decaffeinated starbucks coffee will be given to the participant in the am post operative day two. Participants will have 15 minutes to consume the coffee. Additionally, medical record data will be collected up to 30 days after surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- regular caffeine consumers undergoing unilateral or bilateral microsurgical breast reconstruction with DIEP flap(s) at the University of Michigan Health System
Exclusion Criteria:
- smokers
- hepatic or renal disease (comorbidities that affect caffeine metabolism)
- male

eligibility.gender_description: only women scheduled to undergo unilateral or bilateral microsurgical breast reconstruction will be enrolled
